entry.def: A rocky place is covered with rocks or consists of large areas of rock and has nothing growing on it.

example.ex: The paths are often very rocky so strong boots are advisable.
example.tran: 路上通常石头很多，所以最好穿结实耐磨的靴子。

entry.tran: （局势、关系）不稳定的，不稳固的，困难重重的
entry.def: A rocky situation or relationship is unstable and full of difficulties.

example.ex: They had gone through some rocky times together when Ann was first married...
example.tran: 当安刚结婚时，他们已经一起度过了一些艰难时光。

example.ex: Their relationship had gotten off to a rocky start.
example.tran: 他们的关系在磕磕绊绊中开始了。

example.en: You're stubborn as a Rocky Mountain canary.

Sentence.sentence: If such an earthquake happened today, it would be felt from the Rocky Mountains to the Atlantic Ocean and would flatten most of the cities in the Mississippi valley.

sentences.en: Madeleine placed it carefully in the rocky niche.
sentences.cn: 玛德琳小心翼翼地把它放在岩石壁龛里。

sentences.en: There is only one port along this rocky coast.
sentences.cn: 这个多岩石的海岸只有一个港口。

sentences.en: It took us the whole day to trek across the rocky terrain.
sentences.cn: 我们花了一整天的时间艰难地穿过那片遍布岩石的地带。

sentences.en: This chair is a trifle rocky.
